smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface FragmentContract is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface FrostContentParent is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface FrostContentCore is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

smells.name: FunctionNaming

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FbUrlTest.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of RoundCornerTransformation.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of NestedWebView.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FrostJSI.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FrostChromeClient.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of L.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of IntroActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of AboutActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of SettingsActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FrostWebActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of LoginActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of BadgedIcon.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of Keywords.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FrostApp.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses around the lambda ({ callback(false) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (if (Prefs.showRoundedIcons) 2f else 10f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (Prefs.showRoundedIcons) 2f else 10f
Parentheses in (FbTabModel::class) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: FbTabModel::class
Parentheses in (name?.isNotBlank() == true) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: name?.isNotBlank() == true
Parentheses in (url?.contains("?sk=h_chr") ?: false) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: url?.contains("?sk=h_chr") ?: false
Parentheses in (web.url?.contains("?sk=h_chr") ?: false) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: web.url?.contains("?sk=h_chr") ?: false
Parentheses in (web.context as? ActivityContract) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: web.context as? ActivityContract
Parentheses in (Color.alpha(Prefs.bgColor) != 255) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Color.alpha(Prefs.bgColor) != 255
Parentheses in (startsWith("https://video-") && contains(FBCDN_NET)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: startsWith("https://video-") && contains(FBCDN_NET)
Parentheses in (atStart == toStart) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: atStart == toStart
Parentheses around the lambda ({ progress((it * 0.85f).toInt()) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ false }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ emptySet() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (position < 0 && position > -1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: position < 0 && position > -1
Parentheses in (position > 0 && position < 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: position > 0 && position < 1
Parentheses in (if (translateValue > -pageWidth) translateValue else 0f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (translateValue > -pageWidth) translateValue else 0f
Parentheses around the lambda ({ refresh = it != 100 }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ parent.progressObservable.onNext(it) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: com.pitchedapps.frost.utils.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class WebContext defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class MenuData contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called flatMapValid
The data class FrostNotification contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called withAlert
The data class FrostNotification contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called notify

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `it to SingleSubject.create<Boolean>()`

smells.name: CollapsibleIfStatements
